  • Method Details

    • format

      public static java.lang.String format​(java.lang.String messagePattern, java.lang.Object... arguments)
      Returns a formatted String by replacing each instance of {} place holders with the given arguments.
      Parameters:
      messagePattern - the message pattern containing place holders.
      arguments - the arguments to be used to replace place holders.
      Returns:
      String the formatted message

    • stripSurroundingQuotes

      public static java.lang.String stripSurroundingQuotes​(java.lang.String text)
      Returns the string passed without surrounding single (') or double (") quotes if they exist. Otherwise it returns the string unchanged. Quotes inside the string will not be removed. Likewise, if there are not matching quotes on both ends, a leading or trailing quote will be left unmodified.
      Parameters:
      text - String the text to check for surrounding quotes
      Returns:
      String the text without surrounding quotes (if they exist)

    • ordinal

      public static java.lang.String ordinal​(int i)
      Constructs the ordinal string of the given int. For example "1st", "2nd", "111th"
      Parameters:
      i - int the integer to create an ordinal string for
      Returns:
      String the ordinal string

    • inputStreamToString

      public static java.lang.String inputStreamToString​(java.io.InputStream inputStream) throws java.io.IOException
      Returns a String for a given InputStream object.

      https://stackoverflow.com/questions/309424/how-do-i-read-convert-an-inputstream-into-a-string-in-java Answer #3, option #8 which has a significantly faster execution time.

      Parameters:
      inputStream - the InputStream which contains an incoming String
      Returns:
      String the String representation of the incoming InputStream
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if the InputStream cannot be opened or read

    • parseOrdinal

      public static int parseOrdinal​(java.lang.String stringStartingWithInteger)
      Converts the leading integer portion of a string to an int. Examples:
      • parseOrdinal("12th") = 12
      • parseOrdinal("1t2h3") = 1
      • parseOrdinal("ten") throws Exception
      Parameters:
      stringStartingWithInteger - String a string with leading integers.
      Returns:
      int the integers in the passed string up until the point of the first non-numeric character.

    • replaceVariable

      public static java.lang.String replaceVariable​(java.lang.String text)
      Returns a string with any strings enclosed in curly braces "{}" replaced with values stored in the passed YAMLData object under testdata/variables. For example, given the string "{first_name} Smith" and the yaml entry in the passed file: testdata: default: variables: first_name: Bob This method would return: "Bob Smith". If there are no values to replace, this method returns the string intact.
      Parameters:
      text - String the text to search for variable replacement
      Returns:
      String the string with variables replaced as applicable
